meanings.definition: To record a television program by filming the screen with a camera.
meanings.sent1: I saw my dad kinescoping his favorite show last night.
meanings.sent2: She enjoys kinescoping old movies to watch later.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed interested in kinescoping the nature documentary.
meanings.sent4: The artist's eyes were like cameras, kinescoping every detail of the landscape.
meanings.sent5: Kinescoping the sunset painted a beautiful scene on the screen.

meanings.definition: The process of transferring a television program to film for preservation.
meanings.sent1: The kinescoping of classic TV shows helps preserve them for future generations.
meanings.sent2: The studio invested in kinescoping equipment to save important broadcasts.
meanings.sent3: The museum displayed the history of kinescoping in a special exhibit.
meanings.sent4: The kinescoping process was like capturing memories on film.
meanings.sent5: The value of kinescoping lies in archiving cultural moments.

meanings.definition: The act of watching a television program.
meanings.sent1: Her kinescoping of the game show was interrupted by a phone call.
meanings.sent2: Family gatherings often involve shared kinescoping of favorite shows.
meanings.sent3: The kids were caught kinescoping cartoons past their bedtime.
meanings.sent4: His kinescoping of the news was a daily routine after work.
meanings.sent5: The joy of kinescoping together created lasting memories.
